page.title: 02MARYKIRK SCHOOLS OLD AND NEW
page.content: Before the present school was opened in 1968, there were 2 schools for children of the village and surrounding district. The old schools were{Dunthill School}near the old railway station and{Napier School}in the village. Pupils from the village attended Napier School until they were 9 or 10 and then moved up to Dunthill. Liam now lives in Napier School building and Dunthill is part of Gillian's house. Dunthill was the oldest of the 2 schools. It was opened in 1874 and Napier School was opened in 1898. Most of the information about the schools is in the{old log books}kept by the Grampian Regional Archivist at Woodhill House, Aberdeen.
